summary:
(RAG Format)
This 55-year-old business owner presents with evening eating disorders characterized by emotional snacking and compulsive eating episodes. The main triggers appear to be evening isolation and accumulated mental fatigue from a day filled with high demands and low recognition. There is a clear link between feelings of guilt and the need for control, leading to an internalized sense of 'unworthiness' after eating. His perfectionist tendencies, inherited from a demanding family environment, drive his constant pursuit of excellence, at the expense of his emotional well-being.
main_issues: - Evening eating disorders (emotional snacking, compulsive eating)
- Mental exhaustion and cognitive overload from work responsibilities
- Emotional repression masked by rationalization and control
- Diffuse guilt linked to unmet self-imposed standards
- Persistent sense of loneliness and intellectual disconnection
limiting_beliefs: - "I must be flawless to earn my place."
- "If I don't do it myself, it will be done poorly."
therapeutic_goals: - Reduce emotional eating and reframe food as nourishment, not a compensatory tool
- Re-anchor self-worth outside of performance and productivity
- Develop self-compassion and internal validation rituals
- Normalize rest and downtime without self-reproach
- Facilitate safe emotional expression without overcontrol

immediate: - Emotional transition ritual between work and evening: shower + 3 minutes of cardiac coherence breathing
- Journal of emotional 'saturations' at the end of each day
- Emotional rescue box: weighted blanket, comforting scent, positive voice recording
intermediate: - Reconditioning self-worth: daily list of '3 things I did well today'
- Restructuring the day to include emotional rewards (exercise, chosen solitude, sensory relaxation)
- Reducing control schemas through cognitive reframing: 'I can do enough without doing it all.'
long_term: - Hypnosis theme: Releasing the Need for Perfection and Finding Inner Peace
- Anchoring a sense of internal calm despite external pressures
- Transforming guilt into self-compassion and gentle acceptance

motivational_closure: What if excellence no longer meant achieving everything, but daring sometimes to do nothing at all? To dare being humanâ€”even when no box is checked. Your value is not measured in results, but in presence. And you are here.
